cyclone.name: ANA
cyclone.current_location: about 65 miles SSE of Myrtle Beach, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn north on Sunday and then northeast Monday–Tuesday, skirting the NC coast and lifting toward the Delmarva/Mid-Atlantic shoreline before moving back offshore.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the North Carolina–South Carolina border (around Myrtle Beach)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Edisto Beach SC to south of South Santee River SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: South Santee River SC to Cape Lookout NC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Coastline from South Carolina through North Carolina, then northward into Virginia, Maryland, Delaware and southern New Jersey
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤11%) of tropical-storm-force winds; breezy 25–35 mph gusts possible late Monday night–Tuesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor tidal departures (<1 ft) possible in Delaware Bay; no significant surge expected.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of rain possible Tuesday with locally heavier pockets.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along Delaware beaches early next week.
